articles.title: From the Archives, 1962: The space race heats up - The Age
articles.description: In 1962, the space race was heating up between the USA and USSR after American astronaut, John Glenn, returned to Earth after orbiting the globe three times.
articles.content:
Astronaut John Glenn swings himself carefully through the hatch of his Friendship Seven space capsule.Credit:NASA

articles.title: Actor Lindsey Pearlman found dead after going missing in L.A. - CTV News
articles.description: Actor Lindsey Erin Pearlman, who had roles in 'General Hospital,' 'American Housewife' and other shows, was found dead days after she was reported missing in Los Angeles, authorities said.

articles.author: Keva York
articles.title: C’mon C’mon reimagines Joaquin Phoenix as an introspective radio producer who interviews kids about the future - ABC News
articles.description: In Mike Mills's gentle, humanist drama C'mon C'mon, a public-radio producer seeks out to interview young people across America about their hopes and fears for the future — while unexpectedly saddled with a pint-sized travelling companion.

articles.title: ‘We’re in danger of forgetting’: congressman’s warning 80 years after Japanese American incarceration - The Guardian
articles.description: Congressman Mark Takano, whose family was forced into camps, calls for vigilance amid ‘nefarious nostalgia’
articles.content: Eighty years ago, as anti-Japanese fervor gripped the US, the parents and grandparents of the California congressman Mark Takano were among 120,000 Japanese Americans forcibly removed from their home… [+6701 chars]
